00011 #ifndef SYSAPI_WIN32_HH
00012 # define SYSAPI_WIN32_HH
00013 
00014 // @see sysapi.hh
00015 // This file declares the namespace
00016 // used for the win32 system api.
00017 
00018 #include <windows.h>
00019 #include <process.h>
00020 
00021 namespace win32
00022 {
00023   // @see sysapi/win32/file.cc
00024   namespace file
00025   {
00026     // Openning modes
00027     typedef enum
00028       {
00029         RDONLY = GENERIC_READ,
00030         WRONLY = GENERIC_WRITE,
00031         RDWR   = GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE
00032       } mode_t;
00033 
00034     // Seek position
00035     typedef enum
00036     {
00037       BEGIN   = FILE_BEGIN,
00038       CURRENT = FILE_CURRENT,
00039       END     = FILE_END
00040     } pos_t;
00041 
00042     typedef HANDLE handle_t;
00043     typedef DWORD offset_t;
00044     typedef DWORD size_t;
00045 
00046     // Function prototypes
00047     bool        open(handle_t*, const char*, mode_t, int* = static_cast<int*>(0));
00048     bool        create(const char*, mode_t = RDWR, handle_t* = static_cast<handle_t*>(0), int* = static_cast<int*>(0));
00049     bool        close(handle_t, int* = static_cast<int*>(0));
00050     bool        read(handle_t, unsigned char*, size_t, size_t* = static_cast<size_t*>(0), int* = static_cast<int*>(0));
00051     bool        write(handle_t, const unsigned char*, size_t, size_t* = static_cast<size_t*>(0), int* = static_cast<int*>(0));
00052     bool        seek(handle_t, offset_t, pos_t = CURRENT, int* = static_cast<int*>(0));
00053   }
00054 
00055 
00056   // @see sysapi/win32/process.cc
00057   namespace process
00058   {
00059     // options for the wait function
00060     typedef enum
00061       {
00062         DONTWAIT = 0,   // returns if no pending process
00063         WAITFOREVER     // wait until process comes
00064       } waitopt_t;
00065 
00066     // State of the process
00067     typedef enum
00068       {
00069         RUNNING = 0,
00070         BLOCKED,
00071         TERMINATED
00072       } state_t;
00073 
00074     // Signal that can be sent to the process
00075     typedef enum
00076       {
00077         TERMINATE = 0
00078       } sigid_t;
00079 
00080     // Handle on the process
00081     typedef HANDLE handle_t;
00082 
00083 
00084     // Public interface
00085     bool        create_and_loadexec(handle_t*, int, const char**, const char** = NULL);
00086     bool        myhandle(handle_t*);
00087     bool        signal(handle_t, sigid_t);
00088     bool        release(handle_t);
00089     bool        wait_single(handle_t, state_t* = NULL, waitopt_t = WAITFOREVER);
00090     bool        wait_any(handle_t* = NULL, state_t* = NULL, waitopt_t = WAITFOREVER);
00091   }
00092 
00093 
00094   // @see sysapi/win32/thread.cc
00095   namespace thread
00096   {
00097     // Handle on threads
00098     typedef HANDLE handle_t;
00099 
00100     // Thread entry point
00101     typedef void* param_t;
00102     typedef unsigned retcode_t;
00103     typedef retcode_t (__stdcall *entry_t)(param_t);
00104 
00105     // thread states
00106     typedef enum
00107       {
00108         RUNNING = 0,
00109         SUSPENDED,
00110         BLOCKED,
00111         TERMINATED
00112       } state_t;
00113 
00114     // wait options
00115     typedef enum
00116       {
00117         DONTWAIT = 0,
00118         WAITFOREVER
00119       } waitopt_t;
00120 
00121     // Signal id
00122     typedef enum
00123       {
00124         TERMINATE = 0,
00125         RESUME,
00126         SUSPEND
00127       } sigid_t;
00128 
00129 
00130     // Public interface
00131     bool        create_and_exec(handle_t*, state_t, entry_t, param_t = NULL);
00132     bool        attach_to_process(handle_t, win32::process::handle_t);
00133     bool        detach_from_process(handle_t, win32::process::handle_t);
00134     bool        wait_single(handle_t, state_t* = NULL, waitopt_t = WAITFOREVER);
00135     bool        signal(handle_t, sigid_t);
00136     bool        myhandle(handle_t*);
00137     bool        release(handle_t);
00138   }

00141   // @see sysapi/win32/error.cc
00142   namespace error
00143   {
00144     typedef DWORD handle_t;
00145 
00146     handle_t    get();
00147     void        set(handle_t);
00148     void        stringify(const char* = NULL);
00149   }
